main_definition: RFC stands for Request For Comments, which refers to a document series created by the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) and various organizations that describe methods, behaviors, research, or innovations applicable to the working of the Internet and the Internet community.

meanings_and_examples.example: RFC 2616 is a document that describes the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) version 1.1.
The RFC for the Domain Name System (DNS) protocol, DNSSEC, and various other internet-related technical specifications.
RFC 3704 proposes guidelines on using email authentication methods to combat spam.
